intro: Prestonia isthmica, commonly known as the Isthmus prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
